Posts.Content: Hi Invisible Me Apologies for the delayed response Many thanks for your reply.   I will b adding the PICC line to my list of questions and have written a list of things to take to sessions  And yes will definitely listen to my body especially as those supporting me aren't keen about a return to work. It's hard trying to explain u need some normality in this chaos! Thanks again. I hope u r doing ok L
Posts.Title: Preparation for Chemo and herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi. Having today had what I consider to be good news in that I had clear margins from my WLE 2 weeks ago and that only 2 out of the 19 nodes removed were cancerous I now have the prospect of chemo and herceptin later to be followed by tamoxifen.  I have an appointment with the oncology team on Tuesday 6th however I would like to know if there is anything I can do to prepare myself emotionally and physically for chemo. I am also hoping to go back to work on 12th on a phased return (want to be part of Christmas festivities). Thanks
Posts.Title: Preparation for Chemo and herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi Jo.  Thank u very much for your wishes and response. Wow I didn't realise what was involved. I was originally told 6 sessions of chemo over 18 weeks. I am so pleased you have provided so much info. I like detail. I did have a hairloss meltdown earlier this week and found one of the hair specialist at my local mcmillan centre really helpful to allay some of my fears. I will hear what the team say on tuesday and then make the decision about work then Again thank u very much.  Take care BW L

Posts.Title: Fidst chemo session tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi lily I had the same problem with the clamp and asked the nurses to wrap gauze around it and tape it to stop the gauze moving. It has worked a treat.  If you have some gauze you could ask other half to cover it for you. The hospital gives me a couple of sleeves each time it is flushed as they don't last long after washing.  Lisea
Posts.Title: PICC line - advice please

Posts.Content: Hi. I was only in overnight but would definitely recommend an eye mask and ear plugs as it really is hard to sleep. When I came round from surgery my throat was really sore so was also glad to have mint humbugs Hope all goes ok
Posts.Title: What to take to hospital?

Posts.Content: Thanks Carolyn28. The article is really helpful.  I am currently having chemo and managed to up my intake to 2l plus most days.  Will be glad to reduce it as spend much more time going to the loo :)
Posts.Title: Ideal amount of water

Posts.Content: Hi i just wanted to recommend the HOPE course.  I have just completed the 2 week one in Leeds, West Yorkshire.  The benefits have been sharing experiences with others, and developing and utilising skills to overcome some of my issues as a result of chemo and most of all a new friendship network If there is one in your area i really would encourage you to attend Lisea x
